title: 10 Top-Rated Focaccia Recipes to Make at Home
description: Focaccia, the classic Italian bread, is a terrific bread for sandwiches and snacking and for soaking up sauces and dressings. Here are some of our favorite recipes for making homemade focaccia.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 10 Top-Rated Focaccia Recipes to Make at Home By Carl Hanson Carl Hanson Carl Hanson is a Senior Editor at Allrecipes who has been writing about food and wine for nearly 20 years. He enjoys creating content that informs, entertains, and assists busy home cooks get nourishing meals on the table for their families. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Published on January 19, 2021 Close Chef John's Focaccia. Credits: Chef John Focaccia is the classic Italian bread that's light and tender, with a rich taste and texture. Focaccia is a terrific bread for sandwiches and snacks and for soaking up sauces and dressings. It's easy to make, and you can top focaccia with all sorts of toppings: chopped olives, herbs, caramelized onions, tomatoes, sliced grapes, and much more. Here are some of our favorite recipes for homemade focaccia. 01 of 10 Sun Dried Tomato Focaccia View Recipe Save This focaccia features rosemary and garlic, sun-dried tomatoes, Parmesan, and mozzarella. "This isn't just a bread, it's a meal," says Margaret Dunk. "Chewy foccacia with a cheese topping." 02 of 10 Michael's Foccacia Bread View Recipe Save "This version of the classic is easy to make while remaining authentic and true to the original," says MICHAELGLASSCOOK. "This may be the fastest yeast bread you make; it takes only one hour from conception to completion. Romano or Asiago cheese are nice to use instead of Parmesan cheese." 03 of 10 Decorated Focaccia Bread View Recipe Save Jackie Freeman Transform a simple bread recipe into a work of art! "It looks like a complicated project, but actually comes together super fast," says ChefJackie. "Made with traditional yeasted dough, it uses a bit of milk (instead of sugar) to help the yeast rise and give additional flavor. Don't be scared by the prep time, most of the work happens while the dough is rising!" More: How to Decorate Focaccia Bread Like a Work of Edible Art 04 of 10 Chef John's Focaccia View Recipe Save Chef John's Focaccia. Chef John "This is such a fun and versatile bread to make," says Chef John. "I went with a simple but classic rosemary and sea salt topping, but a web search for focaccia will turn up more than just the definition. You'll see dozens of different and delicious toppings with which to accessorize your slab." Watch Chef John's Video for How to Make Focaccia 05 of 10 Easiest Focaccia Recipe View Recipe Save "Extremely easy, fast and cheap," says MORTICIA_ADDAMS. "Great for sandwiches and snacks. You may use more or less olive oil or salt if you wish." 06 of 10 Fantastic Focaccia Bread View Recipe Save Kim "This recipe is simple and easy!" says MISS_MARSH. "You can add garlic, oregano, or sun dried tomatoes to spice it up!" 07 of 10 Easy Rosemary Focaccia View Recipe Save Easy Rosemary Focaccia. Allrecipes "This easy focaccia bread is flavored with plenty of fresh rosemary and olive oil," says Anonymous. "So easy, so delicious!" 08 of 10 Black Olive and Rosemary Focaccia View Recipe Save Black Olive and Rosemary Focaccia. Kim This crispy, rich, rosemary-scented focaccia makes a great appetizer or a "wonderful tasting change from pizza or a great side dish to any meal," says Cheryl Leiser Harding. "Full of flavor and delicious." 09 of 10 Focaccia di Recco View Recipe Save Focaccia di Recco. Chef John This homemade Ligurian-style flatbread is filled with dollops of Crescenza or Stracchino cheese. It's a great technique. "This is a delicious and super fun-to-make Ligurian flatbread," says Chef John. "It's great served as is, but I like it with arugula that's been tossed in a little olive oil." 10 of 10 Sourdough Focaccia alla Genovese View Recipe Save Sourdough Focaccia alla Genovese. Buckwheat Queen This classic Genovese focaccia bread is made without commercial yeast. "I adapted this recipe during the Covid-19 lockdown," says Buckwheat Queen. "Using a mother dough gives the taste an edge commercial yeast just can't achieve. I do the second rise overnight. This way it will be ready to bake for lunchtime." Explore more: Recipes Bread Yeast Bread Recipes Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
